thread.title: APPSC Group 2 Answer Key 2017: 6,67,010 candidates applied for the exam conducted across 1400 centres
thread.title_full: APPSC Group 2 Answer Key 2017: 6,67,010 candidates applied for the exam conducted across 1400 centres

author: FE Online
title: APPSC Group 2 Answer Key 2017: 6,67,010 candidates applied for the exam conducted across 1400 centres
text:
APPSC Group 2 Answer Key 2017: 6,67,010 candidates applied for the exam conducted across 1400 centres APPSC Group 2 Answer Key 2017: 6,67,010 candidates applied for the exam conducted across 1400 centres APPSC Group 2 Exam Answer Key 2017: The exam was conducted by the commission to hire candidates for various executive and non-executive posts. By: FE Online | New Delhi | Published: February 27, 2017 3:27 PM APPSC Group 2 Answer Key 2017 to be released soon. (PTI) 
The Andhra Pradesh Public Service Commission (APPSC) is yet to release the Group 2 examination answer key in the next two to three days on its official website at psc.ap.gov.in. A total of 6,67,010 candidates applied and appeared for the exam that was held across 1400 centres in the country. The examination was held in both online and offline mode and the maximum marks of the exam is 450 marks. This exam was conducted by the commission to hire candidates for various executive and non-executive posts. 
No. of executive vacancies available: 442 posts 
No. of non-executive vacancies available: 540 posts 
You may also want to watch- 
APPSC Group 2 Answer Key 2017: 
Candidates who appeared for the exam can follow the below-mentioned steps to check answer key- Visit the official website of APPSC at psc.ap.gov.in Click on the link ‘The answer keys for group-ii services notification no. 18/2016 (general recruitment)’ Once you enter the page, fill in your OTPR reference number The answer keys link will be available Click on the desired link Pdf file with the answer keys result will open up Save these files for future use 
Candidates who wish to file objections (if any), by filling the form on the official website. Candidates need to fill in their examination ID, name, name of examination, mobile number and postal address in the form. 
About Andhra Pradesh Public Service Commission: 
Established in 1956, Andhra Pradesh Public Service Commission (APPSC) was earlier known as the Andhra Service Commission and was based on the regulations of Madras Public Service Commission. The functions of the Commission include- Direct Recruitment Statutory rules relating to services Disciplinary cases Wound and extraordinary pension cases Please Wait while comments are loading...
